firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.collectionconfigs¶

class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.collectionconfigs.CollectionConfig(config: dict, app: App)¶

Bases: Record

Collection Configuration Record

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – dictionary of things values from json

  • endpoint (obj) – Endpoint()

Examples

Get a list of all Collection Configs

>>> fm.sm.cc.all()
[4, 36, 18, 38, 24, ...]

Get a Collection Config by ID

>>> cc = fm.sm.cc.get(47)

Set a Device by ID to the Collection Config

>>> cc.device_set(21)
True

Set this CC as the default for associate Device Pack

>>> cc.devicepack_set()
True
device_set(id: int) → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Set CollectionConfig for a device by ID. If requested device IDs device pack does not match CC device pack server handles mismatch and will NOT set. If device ID is not found server handles mismatch and will NOT set.

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID for the device as understood by Firemon

Returns:

True if device set

Return type:

bool

device_unset(id: int) → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Unset a device from CollectionConfig

Parameters:

id (int) – The ID for the device as understood by Firemon

Returns:

True if device unset

Return type:

bool

devicepack_set() → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Set CollectionConfig for Device Pack assignment.

Returns:

bool

devicepack_unset() → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Unset CollectionConfig for Device Pack assignment. Effectively sets back to ‘default’

class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.collectionconfigs.CollectionConfigs(api: ~firemon_api.core.api.FiremonAPI, app: ~firemon_api.core.app.App, record=<class 'firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.collectionconfigs.CollectionConfig'>, device_id: int | None = None, devicepack_id: int | None = None)¶

Bases: Endpoint

Collection Configs Endpoint

Parameters:

  • api (obj) – FiremonAPI()

  • app (obj) – App()

Keyword Arguments:

  • record (obj) – default Record object

  • devicepack_id (int) – Device Pack id

  • device_id (int) – Device id

Examples

>>> cc = fm.sm.cc.get(46)
>>> cc = fm.sm.cc.filter(
        activatedForDevicePack=True,
        devicePackArtifactId='juniper_srx')[0]
all() → list[CollectionConfig]¶

Get all Record

Returns:

a list of CollectionConfig(object)

Return type:

list[CollectionConfig]

count() → int¶
Returns:

int

property device_id¶
property devicepack_id¶
ep_name = 'collectionconfig'¶
filter(*args, **kwargs) → list[CollectionConfig]¶

Retrieve a filterd list of CollectionConfigs

Note: review the dictionary for all keywords

Parameters:

**kwargs – key value pairs in a collectionconfig dictionary

Returns:

a list of CollectionConfig(object)

Return type:

list[CollectionConfig]

Examples

>>> fm.sm.cc.filter(devicePackArtifactId='juniper_srx')
[47, 21, 46]
>>> fm.sm.cc.filter(activatedForDevicePack=True, devicePackId=3)
[<CollectionConfig(id='1', name='default')>]
>>> fm.sm.cc.filter(devicePackDeviceType='FIREWALL')
[4, 24, 13, 8, 30, 31, 3, 5, ...]
>>> fm.sm.cc.filter(activatedForDevicePack=True)
[4, 36, 18, 38, 24, 13, 8, 30, ...]

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
